intro: Howardia ringens, commonly known as the red-spotted nettle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. Howardia ringens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
